comments.body: so projects are in both GCE and GKE, so maybe they're Google Cloud Platform (GCP) projects? Would this introduce unnecessary confusion?

hmm, possibly might be confusing, we might not need to be introduce the fact that projects span GCP. I read this as the project related to GCE, which we referred to earlier in the document: "...Google Compute Engine cluster...".

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +168,172 @@![BigQuery](bigquery-logging.png)

We could also fetch the logs from Google Cloud Storage buckets to our desktop or laptop and then search them locally. The following command fetches logs for the counter pod running in a cluster which is itself in a Compute Engine project called `myproject`. Only logs for the date 2015-06-11 are fetched.

comments.body: I expect it'd be preferable to use busybox for this if you can, but you don't have to change it if you don't want to have to re-verify that it works
Given that ubuntu:14.04 is already loaded since it is required for Elasticsearch I thought it was better to just reuse it.
Also, I don't think busybox has bash.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@   containers:
   - name: count
     image: ubuntu:14.04
     args: [bash, -c, 
            'for ((i = 0; ; i++)); do echo "$i: $(date)"; sleep 1; done']
